azerbaijani.text: "Beauty is ten, nine of which is dressing."
"I tried to draw the eyebrow, but I ended up poking the eye."
"Until spring comes, nightingales do not sing."
"Beauty is ten, nine of which is dressing."
"Courage is ten, nine is the ability to escape."
"Courage is ten, nine is the ability to escape."
"Until spring comes, nightingales do not sing."
"Smart bird gets trapped in its beak."
"The dog barks, the caravan passes."
"I wish God had not made the left hand to need the right hand."
"Unearned riches are forbidden."
"Without sowing single wheat you would not harvest thousand ones."
"A man would not lick what he spit."
"Cheap meat never makes a good soup."
"Even if your relative eats your meat, he will never discard your bones."
"Do a good deed, and throw it into the sea. If the fish don’t appreciate it, the Creator will."
"White money should be collected for a black day."
"To tell the dog to catch, and the rabbit to run."
"The child is sweeter than honey."
"Wrap yourself together in a carpet and roll together with your kinsmen."
"One hint is enough for a clever man."
"He can’t see the beam in his own, but he’s looking for an eyelash in someone else’s."
"Mouth will not be sweet when you say "sweet" ."
"A good horse never needs a whip."
"Courage mounteth with occasion."
"Flies are nothing, but they make you sick."
"Tree would bend when it bears fruit."
"Every tree casts shadow on its own bottom."
"Never mind storms and snows for the sake of a friend."
"He doesn’t even urinate on a wound."
"Wise enemy is better than a foolish friend."
"The tip of the pen, power of the sword."
"He gets along with fire and water."
"The forest can’t be without its jackals."
"Drop by drop would make a lake."
"Doing well in return for good is a deed of every man. Doing well for bad is the hallmark of an honorable man."
"Don’t buy a house, buy a neighbor."
"Never check the teeth of a horse that has been given by a wealthy landowner."
"The child who doesn’t cry will not get milk."
"Daughter, I’m telling you; daughter-in-law, listen."
"One hand washes the other hand, which, in turn washes the face."
"Look at my color, know my mood."
"The one who is shy will never have a son."
"A mad man drops a rock into water well, so that thousand wise men cannot take it out."
"Tongue may muddle up and say the truth."
"The dog is sleeping in the cart’s shade but thinks it’s his own."
"Overtakes whom gets, and stones who doesn’t."
"Bless the builders, damn the slayers!"
"The person who learns music late in life will play in his grave."
"Things happen only when the right time comes."
"Teach others what you really know and not what you just read about."
"The more you know, the less you should talk."
"A man says his word to the face."
"Those who get up and marry early, achieve success."
"A faithful friend never becomes a stranger, never mind if he hasn’t seen you for a hundred years."
"Speak not of what you have read, but about what you have understood."
"Grass grows on its roots."
"Hope is better than eating."
"Mollah is a human, if an oak will produce an almond."
"Eating much deprives a person of even eating little."
"Even if one is beautiful, if he does not have a good heart, he is still a bad person."
"Courage is ten, nine is the ability to escape."
"Laughter is the remedy for 1001 illnesses."
"Politeness is not sold in the bazaar."
"One’s own simple bread is much better than someone else’s pilaf."
"Mullah is sick when poor dies."
"A guest is a light in the house."
"Money is dirt on the hands. It washes off very quickly."
"Give a token, never mind if it’s a rotten nut."
"Even the ground has ears."
"I am in need, but not of the entrails; I am in need of a tail."
"Beauty without virtue is a curse."
"Until the lions have their historians, tales of the hunt shall always glorify the hunter."
"Shameful is not the one who doesn’t know, but the one who doesn’t ask."
"Make sure your blanket covers your feet."
"Until spring comes, nightingales do not sing."
"Dog has to have its stomach full."
"Intelligence is in the head, not in the age."
"Take 100 measurements before you make one cut."
"I tried to draw the eyebrow, but I ended up poking the eye"
"Nobody takes his wealth to the other world."
"Pass the bridge that your kinsmen have passed."
"Someone’s end is someone’s beginning."
"One who relies on his neighbor will remain without a dinner."
"Better a good neighbor than a bad relative."
"Don’t tie garlic on your head if you don’t have a headache."
